title.narrative: SWE-2010-171 Donor Supported Governance Reform in Rwanda. Impact on Local Service Provision
SWE-2010-171 Donor Supported Governance Reform in Rwanda. Impact on Local Service Provision

description.narrative: The study deals with decentralisation in Rwanda and its effects on local service provision. The purpose is to explore the expectations and practices that emerge in communities where governance reform is being implemented with donor support. The hypothesis is that locally prevailing norms and institutions, including everyday corruption, determine the outcome of reform, which has therefore not led to the intended mode of governance. Among the research questions are: what services do citizens expect from where? how do local officials perceive their role and handle constraints? what role do development staff have? Case studies in one rural and one urban community will provide knowledge on local agency and dynamics that influence expectations and practices related to service provision, which will help understand how prevailing norms and practices can be modified and under what conditions.
